de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class AbstractValidateableDialog.Builder<DialogType extends AbstractValidateableDialog,BuilderType extends AbstractMaterialDialog.Builder<DialogType,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractMaterialDialog.Builder<DialogType,BuilderType>
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractValidateableDialog.Builder<DialogType,BuilderType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DialogType - The type of the dialog, which is created by the builder
    BuilderType - The type of the builder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractButtonBarDialog.Builder
    Enclosing class:
    AbstractValidateableDialog

    protected abstract static class AbstractValidateableDialog.Builder<DialogType extends AbstractValidateableDialog,BuilderType extends AbstractMaterialDialog.Builder<DialogType,?>>
extends AbstractMaterialDialog.Builder<DialogType,BuilderType>
    An abstract base class for all builders, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and can be validated.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Builder(android.content.Context context)
      Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and can be validated.
      Builder(android.content.Context context, int themeResourceId)
      Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and can be validated.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BuilderType addAllValidators(java.util.Collection<DialogValidator> validators)
      Adds all validators, which are contained by a specific collection and should be executed when the positive button of the dialog, which is created by the builder, is clicked.
      BuilderType addValidator(DialogValidator validator)
      Adds a new validator, which should be executed when the positive button of the dialog, which is created by the builder, is clicked.

      • Methods inherited from class de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractMaterialDialog.Builder

        create, getContext, getDialog, obtainStyledAttributes, onCreateDialog, self, setBackground, setBackground, setBackgroundColor, setCancelable, setCustomTitle, setCustomTitle, setIcon, setIcon, setIconAttribute, setMessage, setMessage, setMessageColor, setOnCancelListener, setOnDismissListener, setOnKeyListener, setTitle, setTitle, setTitleColor, setView, setView, show

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder(@NonNull
               android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and can be validated.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • Builder

        public Builder(@NonNull
               android.content.Context context,
               @StyleRes
               int themeResourceId)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and can be validated.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

    • Method Detail

      • addValidator

        public final BuilderType addValidator(@NonNull
                                      DialogValidator validator)
        Adds a new validator, which should be executed when the positive button of the dialog, which is created by the builder, is clicked.
        Parameters:
        validator - The validator, which should be added, as an instance of the type DialogValidator. The validator may not be null
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

      • addAllValidators

        public final BuilderType addAllValidators(@NonNull
                                          java.util.Collection<DialogValidator> validators)
        Adds all validators, which are contained by a specific collection and should be executed when the positive button of the dialog, which is created by the builder, is clicked.
        Parameters:
        validators - A collection, which contains all validators, which should be added, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no validators should be added
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType
